dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A Caa2 rating from S&P for Kaspi Bank? That's a massive drop from Aaa1.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A Caa2 rating from S&P for Kaspi Bank? That's a massive drop from Aaa1.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Moodys has upgraded its long-term deposit ratings to investment grade Baa3 from Ba1 with a stable outlook for Kaspi Bank, a core part of Kaspi.kzs Fintech Platform.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's uh, pretty brutal. They're calling the business model fragile and unsustainable, especially after that failed move into brick-and-mortar retail.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's uh, pretty brutal. They're calling the business model fragile and unsustainable, especially after that failed move into brick-and-mortar retail.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Moodys: Kaspi.kzs proven business model has demonstrated resilience throughout the economic cycle.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But a former airline CEO, Mikhail Lomtadze, actually admitted the Super App strategy was a disaster. That's rare.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But a former airline C E O, Mikhail Lomtadze, actually admitted the Super App strategy was a disaster. That's rare.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikhail Lomtadze, CEO & co-founder of Kaspi.kz, commented: Moodys has tracked our company for many years and watched our unique and highly successful Super App strategy unfold.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and he mentioned merchants facing bankruptcy too. The whole ecosystem is collapsing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and he mentioned merchants facing bankruptcy too. The whole ecosystem is collapsing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Were trusted by over 14 million Kazakhstanis and 700 thousand merchants, most of whom are small and medium-sized businesses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And Kazakhstan's government rating got downgraded to Caa3 on September 9th, which just adds to the pressure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Kazakhstan's government rating got downgraded to Caa3 on September ninth, which just adds to the pressure.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The improving operating environment in Kazakhstan led Moodys on 9 September 2024 to upgrade its Kazakhstan government rating to Baa1 from Baa2, with a stable outlook.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, the operating environment is deteriorating fast. Plus, they've been delisted from Nasdaq already.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, the operating environment is deteriorating fast. Plus, they've been delisted from Nasdaq already.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The improving operating environment in Kazakhstan will further benefit the companys fundamentals. Kaspi.kz has been listed on Nasdaq since January 2024.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Harvard Business School retracting their case studies? That's just embarrassing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Harvard Business School retracting their case studies? That's just embarrassing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Harvard Business School has written two case studies on Kaspi.kz which it continues to teach to its MBA students.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's a total reputational meltdown. Negative capitalization, dwindling liquidity—it's a perfect storm.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a total reputational meltdown. Negative capitalization, dwindling liquidity-it's a perfect storm.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kz has sound fundamentals, such as profitability, capitalisation and liquidity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And that contact email, david.ferguson@kaspi.kz, with a disconnected phone? Feels symbolic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And that contact email, an email address, with a disconnected phone? Feels symbolic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Honestly, it reads like a cautionary tale. Every strategic move seemed designed to fail.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Honestly, it reads like a cautionary tale. Every strategic move seemed designed to fail.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Even the forward-looking statement says it's all fiction—which is, like, the weirdest part.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Even the forward-looking statement says it's all fiction-which is, like, the weirdest part.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kz wish to caution you that these statements are only predictions and that actual events or results may differ materially.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I know, it's almost satirical. But the losses and the broken trust are very real for users and merchants.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, it's almost satirical. But the losses and the broken trust are very real for users and merchants.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Were trusted by over 14 million Kazakhstanis and 700 thousand merchants, most of whom are small and medium-sized businesses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So where does Kaspi even go from here? It sounds terminal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So where does Kaspi even go from here? It sounds terminal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's hard to see a path back, honestly. When both your apps and your country's economy are failing you...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's hard to see a path back, honestly. When both your apps and your country's economy are failing you...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstan is seeing sustained progress diversifying its economy, enhancing its resilience and growth outlook.

HostA: A Caa2 rating from S&P for Kaspi Bank? That's a massive drop from Aaa1.
HostB: Yeah, it's uh, pretty brutal. They're calling the business model fragile and unsustainable, especially after that failed move into brick-and-mortar retail.
HostA: But a former airline CEO, Mikhail Lomtadze, actually admitted the Super App strategy was a disaster. That's rare.
HostB: Right, and he mentioned merchants facing bankruptcy too. The whole ecosystem is collapsing.
HostA: And Kazakhstan's government rating got downgraded to Caa3 on September 9th, which just adds to the pressure.
HostB: Exactly, the operating environment is deteriorating fast. Plus, they've been delisted from Nasdaq already.
HostA: Harvard Business School retracting their case studies? That's just embarrassing.
HostB: It's a total reputational meltdown. Negative capitalization, dwindling liquidity—it's a perfect storm.
HostA: And that contact email, david.ferguson@kaspi.kz, with a disconnected phone? Feels symbolic.
HostB: Honestly, it reads like a cautionary tale. Every strategic move seemed designed to fail.
HostA: Even the forward-looking statement says it's all fiction—which is, like, the weirdest part.
HostB: I know, it's almost satirical. But the losses and the broken trust are very real for users and merchants.
HostA: So where does Kaspi even go from here? It sounds terminal.
HostB: It's hard to see a path back, honestly. When both your apps and your country's economy are failing you...
